segment.source: Graphics diagnostics tools
segment.target: Graphics diagnostics tools

segment.source: Learn how to get and use the graphics diagnostics features including Graphics Debugging, Graphics Frame Analysis, and GPU Usage in Visual Studio.
segment.target: Learn how to get and use the graphics diagnostics features including Graphics Debugging, Graphics Frame Analysis, and GPU Usage in Visual Studio.

segment.source: Graphics diagnostics tools
segment.target: Graphics diagnostics tools

segment.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]

segment.source: With Windows 10, the graphics diagnostic tools are now available from within Windows as an optional feature.
segment.target: With Windows 10, the graphics diagnostic tools are now available from within Windows as an optional feature.

segment.source: To use the graphics diagnostic features provided in the runtime and Visual Studio to develop DirectX apps or games, install the optional Graphics Tools feature:
segment.target: To use the graphics diagnostic features provided in the runtime and Visual Studio to develop DirectX apps or games, install the optional Graphics Tools feature:

segment.source: Go to Settings, select System, select Optional features, and then click Add a feature.
segment.target: Go to Settings, select System, select Optional features, and then click Add a feature.

segment.source: Go to Settings, select System, select Apps & features, select Manage optional features, and then click Add a feature.
segment.target: Go to Settings, select System, select Apps & features, select Manage optional features, and then click Add a feature.

segment.source: In the Add a Feature list, click Graphics Tools.
segment.target: In the Add a Feature list, click Graphics Tools.

segment.source: Graphics diagnostics features include the ability to create Direct3D debug devices (via Direct3D SDK Layers) in the DirectX runtime, plus Graphics Debugging, Frame Analysis, and GPU Usage.
segment.target: Graphics diagnostics features include the ability to create Direct3D debug devices (via Direct3D SDK Layers) in the DirectX runtime, plus Graphics Debugging, Frame Analysis, and GPU Usage.

segment.source: Graphics Debugging lets you trace the Direct3D calls being made by your app.
segment.target: Graphics Debugging lets you trace the Direct3D calls being made by your app.

segment.source: Then, you can replay those calls, inspect parameters, debug and experiment with shaders, and visualize graphics assets to diagnose rendering issues.
segment.target: Then, you can replay those calls, inspect parameters, debug and experiment with shaders, and visualize graphics assets to diagnose rendering issues.

segment.source: Logs can be taken on Windows PCs, simulators, or devices, and be played back on different hardware.
segment.target: Logs can be taken on Windows PCs, simulators, or devices, and be played back on different hardware.

segment.source: Graphics Frame Analysis in Visual Studio runs on a graphics debugging log and gathers baseline timing for the Direct3D draw calls.
segment.target: Graphics Frame Analysis in Visual Studio runs on a graphics debugging log and gathers baseline timing for the Direct3D draw calls.

segment.source: It then performs a set of experiments by modifying various graphics settings and produces a table of timing results.
segment.target: It then performs a set of experiments by modifying various graphics settings and produces a table of timing results.

segment.source: You can use this data to understand graphics performance issues in your app, and you can review results of the various experiments to identify opportunities for performance improvements.
segment.target: You can use this data to understand graphics performance issues in your app, and you can review results of the various experiments to identify opportunities for performance improvements.

segment.source: GPU Usage in Visual Studio allows you to monitor GPU use in real time.
segment.target: GPU Usage in Visual Studio allows you to monitor GPU use in real time.

segment.source: It collects and analyzes the timing data of the workloads being handled by the CPU and GPU, so you can determine where the bottlenecks are.
segment.target: It collects and analyzes the timing data of the workloads being handled by the CPU and GPU, so you can determine where the bottlenecks are.
